identificationModule.briefTitle: New Options for Treating Knee Osteoarthritis Pain
identificationModule.officialTitle: New Options for Treating Knee Osteoarthritis Pain

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This study will be a single-site, four-arm, randomized, placebo-controlled clinical trial. Knee osteoarthritis patients (N=164) will be randomized to Reiki, Sham Reiki (placebo control), mindfulness meditation (active control), or a waitlist control condition. The three active interventions will be applied for 20 minutes, once a week, for four consecutive weeks in a university laboratory setting.

interventions.name: Reiki
interventions.description: Reiki will be provided by a trained Reiki master with the aim of balancing the flow of energy in the patient's body.

interventions.name: Sham Reiki
interventions.description: Sham Reiki will be delivered by an individual trained to simulate the Reiki interventionist's movements, but they will not visualize patient healing

interventions.name: Mindfulness Meditation
interventions.description: The mindfulness meditation intervention will be adapted from a standardized mindfulness induction script validated in prior research. The mindfulness practice will guide patients to focus attention on breath and body sensations while monitoring and accepting discursive thoughts, negative emotions, and pain. The MM interventionist will be a trained mindfulness provider and have experience using MM in medical settings.

primaryOutcomes.description: The Western Ontario and McMaster Universities Arthritis Index will be used to measure change in osteoarthritis symptoms. Scores range from 0 to 96, with higher scores reflect worse pain, stiffness and physical function
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: One week before treatment to one week after treatment, which comprises a 6 week span

secondaryOutcomes.description: The Patient Health Questionnaire-2 will be used to measure depression. Scores range from 0 to 6, with higher scores reflect worse depression
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: One week before treatment to one week after treatment, which comprises a 6 week span

secondaryOutcomes.description: The Generalized Anxiety Disorder 2-item will be used to measure anxiety. Scores range from 0 to 6, with higher scores reflect worse anxiety.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: One week before treatment to one week after treatment, which comprises a 6 week span

secondaryOutcomes.description: The Pain Catastrophizing Scale will be used to measure pain catastrophizing. Scores range from 0 to 52, with higher scores reflect worse pain catastrophizing
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: One week before treatment to one week after treatment, which comprises a 6 week span

secondaryOutcomes.description: The PROMIS Sleep Disturbance - Short Form 6a will measure changes in sleep. Scores range from 0 to 30, with higher scores reflect greater sleep disturbance
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: One week before treatment to one week after treatment, which comprises a 6 week span

secondaryOutcomes.description: The WHOQOL-BREF will measure quality of life. Scores range from 0 to 100, with higher scores reflect better quality of life
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: One week before treatment to one week after treatment, which comprises a 6 week span

secondaryOutcomes.description: Single item assessing pain intensity ("How much pain do you have?") scored on an 11-point (0=Not at all, 10=Very much) numeric rating scale. Higher scores indicate greater pain intensity.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Immediately before to after the first and last treatment session, which comprises a 20 minute span

otherOutcomes.description: Change in self-transcendent state will be measured with the Nondual Awareness Dimensional Assessment - State Version. Scores range from 0 to 10, with higher scores reflecting greater self-transcendence.
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: Immediately before to after the first and last treatment session, which comprises a 20 minute span

otherOutcomes.description: Change in state decentering will be measured with the Metacognitive Processes of Decentering Scale - State Version. Scores range from 0 to 10, with higher scores reflecting greater state decentering.
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: Immediately before to after the first and last treatment session, which comprises a 20 minute span

otherOutcomes.description: Change in trait self-transcendence will be assessed with the Nondual Awareness Dimensional Assessment - Trait Version. Scores range from 0 to 10, with higher scores reflecting greater trait self-transcendence.
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: One week before treatment to one week after treatment, which comprises a 6 week span

otherOutcomes.description: Change in trait decentering will be assessed with the Metacognitive Processes of Decentering Scale - Trait Version. Scores range from 0 to 10, with higher scores reflecting greater trait decentering.
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: One week before treatment to one week after treatment, which comprises a 6 week span

otherOutcomes.measure: Change in Prescription Pain Medication Misuse
otherOutcomes.description: The PROMIS Prescription Pain Medication Misuse v1.0 - Short Form 7a will measure prescription pain medicine misuse. Scores range from 0 to 35, with higher scores reflecting greater misuse.
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: One week before treatment to one week after treatment, which comprises a 6 week span

otherOutcomes.description: Pleasant sensation ratio as measured by Sensation Manikin, a measure comprised of a visual body map to demonstrate the location and distribution of sensations.
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: Immediately before to after the first and last treatment session, which comprises a 20 minute span

otherOutcomes.description: Pain threshold and tolerance, temporal summation, and conditioned pain modulation
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: Immediately before the first treatment session and immediately after the last treatment session, which comprises a 4 week span

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Osteoarthritis in at least one knee
* Report a WOMAC pain score average \>/= 2
* Not using any kind of energy therapy different from the proposed study
* Ability to read, understand and speak English

Exclusion Criteria:

* Knee arthroplasty in the previous year
* Have cognitive impairment as determined by clinical interview
